Biology: Matriculated student in good academic standing at UW Seattle.
Chemistry: Factors in the admission decision include academic performance as measured by GPA in courses required for application, difficulty of other courses completed, frequency of incompletes or withdrawal grades, number of repeated courses, relevant work and life experience, and record of honors.
Individualized Studies: Identify the unifying interdisciplinary theme of the program.
Korean: Minimum 20 credits of college coursework (or department-approved equivalent) in the intended primary language of concentration.
Linguistics: Completion of at least the third quarter, or equivalent, of a foreign language, with a minimum 2.0 grade
Neurobiology: Completion of most supporting coursework in physics, math, and chemistry recommended (see specific course lists, below), with minimum 2.50 GPA in any such work completed at time of application
South Asian Languages and Literature (Hi: Minimum 20 credits of college coursework (or department-approved equivalent) in the intended primary language of concentration.
Speech and Hearing Sciences: Bachelorâ€™s degree or advanced degree outside the area of speech and hearing sciences
Community, Environment, and Planning: Minimum 90 credits completed when student begins the program and at least 80 percent of general education requirements fulfilled
Education, Communities, and Organization: Satisfactory progress toward completion of general education requirements
Civil and Environmental Engineering: Admission is for autumn quarter only. Departmental application deadline is July 1.

Biology: Minimum 2.50 cumulative GPA for any supporting chemistry, physics, mathematics, and biology courses (or other courses that may apply to major requirements) completed at time of application.
Chemistry: Recommended minimum cumulative GPA of 2.50/2.0 in course requirements with no individual grade lower than a 2.0/1.7 for B.S./B.A.
Communication: Minimum 2.50 cumulative GPA for all college coursework, including transfer credits
Comparative Literature: Completion of one course fulfilling either College of Arts and Sciences English composition requirement or the W (writing) requirement (5 credits)
Composition (Music): portfolio of recent compositions, scores, and recordings
Dance: Successful completion of 5 credits in any of the required core courses for the major.
History: Completion of 10 credits of college history with a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.50
Individualized Studies: Make a list of courses taken or planned to be taken toward this goal. This list should comprise between 50 and 70 quarter credits, all of which are related to the area of concentration. These courses must come from at least two departments, but may come from any number of areas, so long as interrelationships are discernible. Most courses must be at the 300- or 400-level. At least half the 50-70 credits selected for the major must come from courses taught within the College of Arts and Sciences.
Integrated Social Sciences: Minimum 2.00 GPA in all transferable college coursework
Korean: Completion of one writing course (W-prefix) taught in English with a minimum 2.0 grade.
Linguistics: Completion of either LING 200, LING 400, or an approved introductory linguistics course; at least one writing (W) course; and one additional quantitative and symbolic reasoning (QSR) course. Minimum 2.0 grade in each course and a cumulative 2.50 GPA in the three courses
Microbiology: Completion of the following prerequisite courses with a minimum 2.25 cumulative GPA : BIOL 180, BIOL 200, BIOL 220; CHEM 142, CHEM 152, CHEM 162; CHEM 223 or CHEM 237.
Philosophy: completion of 10 credits of philosophy coursework
Political Science: Three introductory political science courses (15 credits)
South Asian Languages and Literature (Hi: Completion of one writing course (W-prefix) taught in English with a minimum 2.0 grade.
Education, Communities, and Organization: Two-to-three page personal statement reflecting an interest in the early childhood and family studies major and a commitment to learning about the field
Civil and Environmental Engineering: Applicants must be currently enrolled at the UW and must have a minimum 15 credits taken in residence at the UW.
Nursing: Three or four of the total prerequisite science courses completed with a minimum 3.00 or 2.80 GPA respectively
Social Welfare: Completion of or enrollment in at least one of five prerequisite courses, three or more of which must be completed prior to beginning the program degree requirements in autumn of the junior year.

Communication: Essay explaining what led applicants to apply to the major
Dance: Successful completion of or registration in at least one technique course.
History: Completion of 10 credits of composition/writing courses with a minimum 2.0 grade for each course.
Individualized Studies: Draft a statement that describes the proposed major and discusses the interrelationships among the courses chosen. Propose a brief, descriptive title for the major.
Integrated Social Sciences: Minimum 2.50 GPA in all courses applied to ISS major requirements
Korean: The department prefers that prospective majors present a cumulative 2.50 GPA.
South Asian Languages and Literature (Hi: The department prefers that prospective majors present a cumulative 2.50 GPA. Students with a cumulative GPA below 2.50 may be considered for the major if they submit materials in addition to transcripts, clarifying any aspect of past coursework. Denied applicants may appeal.
Education, Communities, and Organization: Overall academic performance reflected in copies of unofficial transcripts
Civil and Environmental Engineering: Minimum 2.0 grade in each course required for admission
Informatics: Positive grades in courses required for admission to the major

Individualized Studies: Submit the proposal to the Individualized Studies Committee for initial approval. Prospective majors should submit proposals to the Individualized Studies Committee for review at least three quarters prior to graduation.
Integrated Social Sciences: Completion in high school or community college of College Academic Distribution Requirement (CADR).
Korean: Transfer students must be enrolled at the UW before applying to the major.
South Asian Languages and Literature (Hi: Transfer students must be enrolled at the UW before applying to the major.
Speech and Hearing Sciences: Three letters of recommendation sent to the department.
Education, Communities, and Organization: Other evidence of interest in and commitment to the field (e.g., work experience, volunteer experience, or internships)
Civil and Environmental Engineering: minimum 2.50 cumulative GPA for all courses required for admission
Informatics: Personal statement reflecting an interest in and commitment to becoming a major in this field
Social Welfare: Fifty community service/student leadership hours in college and high school

Individualized Studies: Identify at least two faculty sponsors for the major. The faculty sponsors attest to the intellectual soundness of the proposal and agree to provide whatever guidance is jointly decided upon. They may also suggest changes in the previously approved written proposal or list of courses.
Integrated Social Sciences: Demonstrated progress toward University and College of Arts and Sciences general education requirements
Education, Communities, and Organization: Grades in any completed recommended courses and courses applied to major requirements
Informatics: Other evidence of interest in and commitment to the field (e.g., work experience, internships).
Nursing: 100 hours of health care experience in a paid or volunteer position in one setting for three months or more, completed within 12 months preceding submission of the application

Individualized Studies: Obtain final approval from an Individualized Studies adviser.
Korean: The most recent course completed in the intended primary language of concentration must be taken through the UW, with a minimum 2.5
South Asian Languages and Literature (Hi: The most recent course completed in the intended primary language of concentration must be taken through the UW, with a minimum 2.5
Nursing: After an initial review of all applications, some are asked to attend a proctored essay session.

Individualized Studies: Transfer students must be enrolled at the UW before applying to the major.
Social Welfare: Courses in psychology, sociology, economics/political science, and human biology must all be completed prior to beginning required SOC WF courses
An introductory statistics class may be taken as late as spring quarter of the junior year, but is a required prerequisite of senior-year courses and is recommended prior to admission.
Offical copies of all college transcripts
